title.narrative: H&S IR1.1: SOL - EPI PLUS

description.narrative: H&S IR1.3: Sol - EPI Plus ntenance of polio-free status and enhanced progress towards the achievement of the global twin goals of measles elimination and hepatitis B control in Solomon Islands., which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: HIV&AIDS Programme Component Results (PCR) 6 IR6.1: By 2017, at least six PICs have PPTCT, HIV Testing & Counselling and ART policies/ guidelines and services in line with the international and global recommendations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: H&S IR1.3: Sol - EPI Plus ntenance of polio-free status and enhanced progress towards the achievement of the globaltwin goals of measles elimination and hepatitis B control in Solomon Islands.

description.narrative: Improved capacity in managing, forecasting, procuring and delivering vaccines resulted in more children being reached, progress in hepatitis B control, maintenance of polio-free status, prevention of endemic transmission of measles and, along with innovative approaches, increased vaccination coverage to 94 per cent of three doses of combined diphtheria/pertussis/tetanus. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2017

title.narrative: Percentage of one year olds who received 3 doses of combined diphtheria /pertussis/ tetanus vaccine (DPT3) or Penta3 vaccine specific sex-disaggregated
